query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Quel color che viltà di fuor mi pinse 2 veggendo il duca mio tornare in volta, 3 più tosto dentro il suo novo ristrinse.
query.result: 1 That color which cowardice from outside painted me 2 seeing my leader turn back, 3 more quickly within his new constricted itself.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 Attento si fermò com’ uom ch’ascolta; 5 ché l’occhio nol potea menare a lunga 6 per l’aere nero e per la nebbia folta.

Please translate each line literally into English.
7 «Pur a noi converrà vincer la punga», 8 cominciò el, «se non . . . Tal ne s’offerse. 9 Oh quanto tarda a me ch’altri qui giunga!».
query.result: 7 “Still to us it will be necessary to overcome the narrow pass,” 8 he began, “if not… Such offered itself. 9 Oh how late to me that another here arrives!”

10 I saw well how he covered 11 the beginning with the other that then came, 12 that were words to the first different;
13 but nonetheless fear his saying became, 14 because I drew the truncated word 15 perhaps to a worse sentence than he held.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 «In questo fondo de la trista conca 17 discende mai alcun del primo grado, 18 che sol per pena ha la speranza cionca?».
query.result: 16 “Into this bottom of the sad valley 17 descends ever anyone from the first grade, 18 who only for pain has the drooping hope?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 Questa question fec’ io; e quei «Di rado 20 incontra», mi rispuose, «che di noi 21 faccia il cammino alcun per qual io vado.
query.result: 19 This question I made; and he “Of rare 20 encounters,” he responded to me, “that of us 21 makes the journey anyone by which I go.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Ver è ch’altra fïata qua giù fui, 23 congiurato da quella Eritón cruda 24 che richiamava l’ombre a’ corpi sui.
query.result: 22 True is that another time here below I was, 23 conspired by that cruel Eryton 24 who recalled the shadows to their bodies.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Di poco era di me la carne nuda, 26 ch’ella mi fece intrar dentr’ a quel muro, 27 per trarne un spirto del cerchio di Giuda.
query.result: 25 Of little was my flesh naked, 26 which made me enter within that wall, 27 to draw forth a spirit from the circle of Judas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 Quell’ è ’l più basso loco e ’l più oscuro, 29 e ’l più lontan dal ciel che tutto gira: 30 ben so ’l cammin; però ti fa sicuro.
query.result: 28 That is the lowest place and the most dark, 29 and the furthest from the heaven that revolves everything: 30 well do I know the way; therefore make yourself secure.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Questa palude che ’l gran puzzo spira 32 cigne dintorno la città dolente, 33 u’ non potemo intrare omai sanz’ ira».
query.result: 31 This swamp that the great stench exhales 32 encircles around the dolent city, 33 where we cannot enter now without wrath.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 E altro disse, ma non l’ho a mente; 35 però che l’occhio m’avea tutto tratto 36 ver’ l’alta torre a la cima rovente,
37 dove in un punto furon dritte ratto 38 tre furïe infernal di sangue tinte, 39 che membra feminine avieno e atto,
40 e con idre verdissime eran cinte; 41 serpentelli e ceraste avien per crine, 42 onde le fiere tempie erano avvinte.
query.result:
34 And he said more, but I do not have it in mind; 35 because the eye had entirely drawn me 36 towards the high tower to the burning summit,
37 where in a point were quickly straight 38 three infernal furies stained with blood, 39 who had feminine limbs and appearance,
40 and with very green hydras were encircled; 41 little serpents and horned snakes had for hair, 42 with which the fierce temples were bound.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
43 E quei, che ben conobbe le meschine 44 de la regina de l’etterno pianto, 45 «Guarda», mi disse, «le feroci Erine.
query.result: 43 And he, who well knew the wretched ones 44 of the queen of eternal weeping, 45 “Look,” he said to me, “the ferocious Erinyes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Con l’unghie si fendea ciascuna il petto; 50 battiensi a palme e gridavan sì alto, 51 ch’i’ mi strinsi al poeta per sospetto.

Please translate each line literally into English.
52 «Vegna Medusa: sì ’l farem di smalto», 53 dicevan tutte riguardando in giuso; 54 «mal non vengiammo in Tesëo l’assalto».

Please translate each line literally into English.
55 «Volgiti ’n dietro e tien lo viso chiuso; 56 ché se ’l Gorgón si mostra e tu ’l vedessi, 57 nulla sarebbe di tornar mai suso».

Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Così disse ’l maestro; ed elli stessi 59 mi volse, e non si tenne a le mie mani, 60 che con le sue ancor non mi chiudessi.
query.result: 58 Thus said the master; and he himself 59 turned me around, and did not hold to my hands, 60 so that with his I might not close them.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 O voi ch’avete li ’ntelletti sani, 62 mirate la dottrina che s’asconde 63 sotto ’l velame de li versi strani.
query.result: 61 O you who have healthy intellects, 62 consider the doctrine that hides itself 63 under the veil of strange verses.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 E già venìa su per le torbide onde 65 un fracasso d’un suon, pien di spavento, 66 per cui tremavano amendue le sponde,
67 non altrimenti fatto che d’un vento 68 impetüoso per li avversi ardori, 69 che fier la selva e sanz’ alcun rattento
70 li rami schianta, abbatte e porta fori; 71 dinanzi polveroso va superbo, 72 e fa fuggir le fiere e li pastori.
query.result:
64 And already was coming up on the turbid waves 65 a crashing of a sound, full of fright, 66 for which trembled both the banks,
67 not otherwise made than by a wind 68 impetuous for the adverse heats, 69 that fiercely the forest and without any delay
70 breaks the branches, knocks down and carries holes; 71 ahead dusty goes proud, 72 and makes flee the beasts and the shepherds.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 Li occhi mi sciolse e disse: «Or drizza il nerbo 74 del viso su per quella schiuma antica 75 per indi ove quel fummo è più acerbo».
query.result: 73 The eyes loosened me and said: “Now straighten the nerve 74 of the face up toward that ancient foam 75 from there where that smoke is most bitter.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Come le rane innanzi a la nimica 77 biscia per l’acqua si dileguan tutte, 78 fin ch’a la terra ciascuna s’abbica,
79 vid’ io più di mille anime distrutte 80 fuggir così dinanzi ad un ch’al passo 81 passava Stige con le piante asciutte.
query.result:
76 As the frogs before the enemy 77 snake through the water disperse all, 78 until each reaches the earth,
79 I saw more than a thousand souls destroyed 80 flee thus before one who at the step 81 was passing Styx with the dry plants.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 Dal volto rimovea quell’ aere grasso, 83 menando la sinistra innanzi spesso; 84 e sol di quell’ angoscia parea lasso.

Please translate each line literally into English.
85 Ben m’accorsi ch’elli era da ciel messo, 86 e volsimi al maestro; e quei fé segno 87 ch’i’ stessi queto ed inchinassi ad esso.
query.result: 85 Well I understood that he was from heaven sent, 86 and I turned to the master; and he made sign 87 that I should stay quiet and bow to him.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 Ahi quanto mi parea pien di disdegno! 89 Venne a la porta e con una verghetta 90 l’aperse, che non v’ebbe alcun ritegno.
query.result: 88 Ah, how full of disdain he seemed to me! 89 He came to the gate and with a small rod 90 he opened it, which he had no restraint.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 «O cacciati del ciel, gente dispetta», 92 cominciò elli in su l’orribil soglia, 93 «ond’ esta oltracotanza in voi s’alletta?
94 Perché recalcitrate a quella voglia 95 a cui non puote il fin mai esser mozzo, 96 e che più volte v’ha cresciuta doglia?
97 Che giova ne le fata dar di cozzo? 98 Cerbero vostro, se ben vi ricorda, 99 ne porta ancor pelato il mento e ’l gozzo».
query.result:
91 “O cast out of heaven, spiteful people,” 92 he began on the horrible threshold, 93 whence this overbearingness in you is attracted?
94 Why do you resist that will 95 to which the end can never be shortened, 96 and which has more than once increased your sorrow?
97 What good is it to give blows in fate? 98 Cerberus yours, if he remembers well, 99 still carries bare the chin and the throat.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
100 Poi si rivolse per la strada lorda, 101 e non fé motto a noi, ma fé sembiante 102 d’omo cui altra cura stringa e morda
103 che quella di colui che li è davante; 104 e noi movemmo i piedi inver’ la terra, 105 sicuri appresso le parole sante.
query.result:
100 Then he turned to the dirty road, 101 and did not make a saying to us, but made semblance 102 of a man whom another care binds and bites
103 than that of the one who is before him; 104 and we moved the feet toward the earth, 105 secure near the holy words.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Dentro li ’ntrammo sanz’ alcuna guerra; 107 e io, ch’avea di riguardar disio 108 la condizion che tal fortezza serra,
109 com’ io fui dentro, l’occhio intorno invio: 110 e veggio ad ogne man grande campagna, 111 piena di duolo e di tormento rio.
query.result:
106 Inside we entered without any war; 107 and I, who had desire to look at 108 the condition that such a fortress encloses,
109 as I was inside, I send the eye around: 110 and I see on every hand a great plain, 111 full of sorrow and of wicked torment.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 Sì come ad Arli, ove Rodano stagna, 113 sì com’ a Pola, presso del Carnaro 114 ch’Italia chiude e suoi termini bagna,
115 fanno i sepulcri tutt’ il loco varo, 116 così facevan quivi d’ogne parte, 117 salvo che ’l modo v’era più amaro;
118 ché tra li avelli fiamme erano sparte, 119 per le quali eran sì del tutto accesi, 120 che ferro più non chiede verun’ arte.

Please translate each line literally into English.
121 Tutti li lor coperchi eran sospesi, 122 e fuor n’uscivan sì duri lamenti, 123 che ben parean di miseri e d’offesi.
query.result: 121 All their lids were suspended, 122 and from them came forth such harsh lamentations, 123 that they truly seemed of the miserable and of the offended.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 E io: «Maestro, quai son quelle genti 125 che, seppellite dentro da quell’ arche, 126 si fan sentir coi sospiri dolenti?».
query.result: 124 And I: “Master, who are those people 125 who, buried within those tombs, 126 make themselves heard with sorrowful sighs?”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 E quelli a me: «Qui son li eresïarche 128 con lor seguaci, d’ogne setta, e molto 129 più che non credi son le tombe carche.
query.result: 127 And they to me: “Here are the heresiarchs 128 with their followers, of every sect, and much 129 more than you believe the tombs are full.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Simile qui con simile è sepolto, 131 e i monimenti son più e men caldi». 132 E poi ch’a la man destra si fu vòlto,
133 passammo tra i martìri e li alti spaldi.
query.result:
130 Similar here is buried with similar, 131 and the monuments are more and less warm. 132 And then, when he had turned to the right hand,
133 we passed among the martyrs and the high tombs.
